G5136-d-01-09-02-WC.Primary Accident Cause: Train outside yard limits in non block territory, excessive speed
G5136-d-01-09-02-WC.Accident Cause: Train outside yard limits in non block territory, excessive speed
G5136-d-01-09-02-WC.Narrative: LOADED ORE TRAIN, XOSTES, CONSISTING, OF 3 LOCOMOTIVES (2 ON THE HEAD END AND ONE HELPER AT THE REAR) AND 97 LOADED ORE CARS WAS TRAVELING ON MAIN LINE TRACK AT 30.9 MPH WHEN THE CREW NOTICED SPARKS FROM THEIR TRAIN.  THE CREW STARTED TO SLOW THE TRAIN DOWN WHEN IT WENT INTO EMERGENCY.  ONCE THE TRAIN CAME TO A STOP, THE CREW INVESTIGATED AND FOUND THAT 25 CARS HAD DERAILED.  INVESTIGATION INTO THE INCIDENT FOUND THAT THE SPEEDOMETER IN THE LEAD LOCOMOTIVE WAS OFF AND THE ENGINEER WAS TRAVELINGALOMOST 6 MPH OVER THE RESTRICED SPEED FOR THAT AREA.  THE MAXIMUM SPEED ALLOWED FOR LOADED ORE TRAINS ON THIS TRACK WAS 30 MPH BUT THE AREA HAD ALSO BEEN FURTHER RESTRICTED TO 25 MPH BY A TRACK BULLETIN.  THE HELPER ENGINEER FAILED TO COMMUNICATE THE OVER SPEED TO THE LEAD LOCOMOTIVE ENGINEER AS INDICATED BY THE ACCURATE SPEEDOMETER ON THE HELPER LOCOMOTIVE THUS ALLOWING THE TRAIN TO TRAVEL AT SPEED ABOVE THE RESTRICTIONS.  THERE WAS ALSO A TRANSPORTATION MANAGER ON THE LEAD LOCOMOTIVE AT THE TIME OF THE DERAILMENT.NoneNoneNoneNone

G5137-d-01-11-02-WC.Primary Accident Cause: Buffing or slack action excessive, train handling
G5137-d-01-11-02-WC.Accident Cause: Buffing or slack action excessive, train handling
G5137-d-01-11-02-WC.Narrative: TRAIN, BRFD1T, CONSISTING OF 3 LOCOMOTIVES, 58 LOADS AND 101 EMPTIES WAS TRAVELING AT APPROX. 8 MPHON THE EAST FREIGHT TRACK WHEN THE REAR OF THE TRAIN RAN IN AFTER THE BRAKES WERE APPLIED IN EMERGENCY CAUSING 3 CARS TO DERAIL.  INVESTIGATION INTO THE INCIDENT FOUND THAT THE ENGINEER THOUGHT HE WASAT JCT. 17 AND HAD TO STOP FOR A SIGNAL, WHICH HE WASN'T.  HE USED THE INDEPENDENT BRAKE AND COMBINATION OF HEAVY AIR APPLICATION WHICH PUT THE TRAIN INTO EMERGENCY AND STOP.  THIS CAUSED THE REAR OFTHE TRAIN TO RUN IN AND 3 CARS TO DERAIL.  A FOURTH CAR SUSTAINED DAMAGE BUT WAS NOT DERAILED.  THECREW WAS TESTED AND ALL RESULTS WERE NEGATIVE.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

G5138-d-01-31-02-WC.Primary Accident Cause: Speed, other (Provide detailed description in narrative)
G5138-d-01-31-02-WC.Accident Cause: Speed, other (Provide detailed description in narrative)
G5138-d-01-31-02-WC.Narrative: TRAIN, FDNS1T-31, CONSISTING OF 2 LOCOMOTIVES, 43 LOADS AND 27 EMPTIES WAS OPERATING UNDER CTC AT 34.3 MPH INTO THE NDCS SIDING AT WAUKESHA.  THE ENGINEER HEAD THE AIR SET AS HE PULLED INTO THE SIDINGAND FELT LATERAL MOVEMENT AND THEN THE TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY.  A CONDUCTOR THAT WAS ON THE GROUND DOING A ROLL-BY SAW THE DERAILMENT UNFOLDING AND RAN FOR SAFETY SUSTAINING AN INJURY TO HIS LEFTKNEE IN THE PROCESS.  ONE ENGINE AND 27 CARS WERE DERAILED.  TWO OF THE DERAILED CARS WERE RESIDUE HAZARDOUS CARS AND THERE WAS NO RELEASE.  ONE LOADED CAR ENDED UP IN THE FOX RIVER.  INVESTIGATION INTO THE INCIDENT FOUND THAT THE TRAIN WAS BEING OPERATED AT A SPEED THAT EXCEEDED THE MAXIMUM AUTHORIZED SPEED AS IT ENTERED THE SIDING AND WAS THE CAUSE OF THE DERAILMENT.  THE CREW WAS TESTED AND ALLRESULTS WERE NEGATIVE.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

G5139-d-01-28-02-WC.Primary Accident Cause: Shoving movement, absence of man on or at leading end of movement
G5139-d-01-28-02-WC.Accident Cause: Shoving movement, absence of man on or at leading end of movement
G5139-d-01-28-02-WC.Narrative: WHILE PERFORMING SWITCHING DUTIES, JOB 1905NN, WAS SWITCHING ON THE TOP END OF THE NORTH YARD.  THECREW HAD KICKED 4 CARS INTO 38 TRACK AND THE CONDUCTOR WENT INTO GET THE TRACK TOGETHER AS THEY NEEDED MORE ROOM.  THEY COUPLED UP TO 38 TRACK, STRTCHED AND CHECKED WITH ANOTHER CONDUCTOR AS TO HOW MUCH ROOM THEY HAD ON THE SOUTH END.  HE WAS TOLD 10 CARS.  THE 1905NN FAILED TO FIGURE IN THE FACT THAT HE HAD BULKHEAD FLAT CARS AND ONLY TOOK INTO ACCOUNT THE NUMBER OF CARS THAT SHOULD FIT ON THE TRACK.  INVESTIGATION INTO THE INCIDENT REVEALED THA THE CONDUCTOR FAILED TO PROTECT HIS SHOVE MOVE AND THEY SHOVED OUT THE SOUTH END OF 38 TRACK AND INTO CARS THAT WERE ON THE LEAD FOR 39 TRACK.  AS THEY SHOVED OUT THEIR TRAIN, IT STARTED TO PULL THE CARS ON 39 TRACK DOWN, FORCING 1 CAR IN 38 TRACK OFF THE RAIL AND INTO A CAR THAT WAS ON THE SOUTH END OF 37 TRACK.  IN TOTAL, THERE WERE 3 CARS THATSUSTAINED DAMAGE AND 1 CAR THAT WAS DERAILED IN THIS SWITCHING INCIDENT.NoneNoneNoneNoneNone

G5134-d-01-02-02-WC.Primary Accident Cause: Failure to properly secure hand brake on car(s) (railroad  employee)
G5134-d-01-02-02-WC.Accident Cause: Failure to properly secure hand brake on car(s) (railroad  employee)
G5134-d-01-02-02-WC.Narrative: WHILE PERFORMING SWITCHING DUTIES, JOB Y186-2 STARTED OUT WITH 12 CARS - 8 LOADS AND 4 EMPTIES.  THECREW PULLED NORTH, OFF SPOT, TO SET 2 EMPTIES OUT TO TRACK 260.  THE CONDUCTOR TIED ONE HANDBRAKE ON THE EMPTY CARS.  THE CREW THEN PULLED NORTH APPROX. 4 CARS TO SET 2 LOADS BACK ON TRACK 745 OFF OFTRACK 709.  THE CONDUCTOR SET THE 2 LOADS ON THE LEAD WITH ONE HANDBRAKE SET AND CUT AWAY TO SET ONE LOAD ON TRACK 260.  THE CREW THEN SHOVED BACK ON TRACK 260, CUT AWAY, TIED ONE HANDBRAKE AND PULLED OVER THE SWITCH TO TRACK 109 TO SET A CAR TO TRACK 745.  THE CREW SHOVED BACK, MADE A JOINT ON THECARS IN THE TRACK, CUT THE AIR IN AND TOOK THE HANDBRAKE OFF.  THEY SHOVED ONE CAR LENGTH, STOPPEDAND THE CONDUCTOR TIED ONE HANDBRAKE ON THE CAR.  THEY THEN CUT AWAY TO PULL OUT AND GET A LOAD FROMTRACK 260.  WHILE PULLING NORTH, CAR CSXT 254227 ROLLED BACK ON TRACK 260 AND INT CRDX 7551, THE FIFTH CAR IN THE TRAIN, CAUSING BOTH CARS TO TIP ONTO THEIR SIDES.  INVESTIGATION INTO THE INCIDENT FOUND THAT THE CONDUCTOR HAD FAILED TO PROPERLY SECURE THE HANDBRAKES ON CSXT 254227 THUS ALLOWING ITTO ROLL BACK AND INTO THE SIDE OF THEIR TRAIN STRIKING CRDX 7551.NoneNoneNone

170354-d-01-07-02-SOO.Narrative: TRAIN 288-07 MADE CONTACT WITH VEHICLE AT HWY 80 GRADE CROSSING AT NEW LISBON, WI.  DRIVER OF VEHICLE SUSTAINED SERIOUS, BUT NON LIFE THREATENING INJURIES.  DRIVER WAS TRAVELING NORTH ON HWY 80.  TRAIN CREW ADVISED, AS THE HWY 80 CROSSING GATES LOWERED, THE MERCURY SABLE MADE AN ABRUPT STOP AND FOULED THE SOUTH RAIL OF THE MAIN TRACK.  WHEN CROSSING GATE WAS FULLY LOWERED IT RESTED ON THE VEHICLE'S TRUNK.  WHEN THE TRAIN APPROACHED HWY 80 CROSSING THE DRIVER MADE A FUTILE ATTEMPT TO BACK HER CARAWAY FROM THE TRACKS.  TRAIN WAS TRAVELING 43.2 MPH WHEN CONTACT WAS MADE WITH THE VEHICLE, AUTHORIZED SPEED AT THIS LOCATION IS 50 MPH. TRAIN CREW HAD APPROX. 300 FT SIGHT-LINE VIEW OF VEHICLE AT HWY 80 GRADE CROSSING.  ENGINEER PUT TRAIN INTO EMERGENCY WHEN CONTACT WAS MADE WITH VEHICLE AT CROSSING, DISTANCE TO STOP WAS .4230 MILES OR 2234 FT.  CROSSING PROTECTION: STANDARD FLASHERS, GATES, AUDIBLE AND ADVANCE WARNING SIGNS.NoneNoneNoneNoneNone

ID02032-d-01-17-02-GSWR.Narrative: T-HAULER WESTBOUND IN SMITHVILLE BLOCK OPERATING WITH 2 LOCOMOTIVES AND 20 CARS (2/18-NO HAZARDOUS)ENCOUNTERED MISSING ROADBED AT MP 303.2 NEAR SHELLMAN, RANDOLPH COUNTY, GEORGIA.  LEAD UNIT GSWR 3837 FELL INTO ROADBED VOID, RESTING IN A PARALLEL POSITION WITH TRACK; TRAILING UNIT GSWR 4028 RODE ACROSS THE TOP OF UNIT 3837 AND CAME TO REST IN A PERPENDICULAR POSITION TO TRACK.  RAILCARS GSWR 1244, GSWR 1294, AND GSWR 1228 (ALL EMPTY GONDOLAS) FOLLOWING IN POSITIONS 3, 4 AND 5 IN TRAIN CONSIST DERAILED: 1244 AND 1294 FOLLOWED LOCOMOTIVES INTO VOID AND WERE COMPLETELY DERAILED; 1228 REMAINED ONMAIN TRACK STRUCTURE WITH ONLY ONE SET OF WHEELS DERAILED.  CONDUCTOR/ENGINEER TRAINEE WAS THROWN FROM LEADING UNIT GSWR 3837 AND WAS ABLE TO WALK TO TLEPHONE LOCATION TO SUMMONS HELP.  OPERATIONS MANAGER/ENGINEER WAS KILLED INSTANTLY IN LEAD UNIT.  AT TIME OF DERAILMENT NO FIRE OR DIESEL FUEL SPILLAGE WAS EVIDENT, HOWEVER DURING CLEARING OPERATIONS APPROXIMATELY 2,00 GALLONS OF DIESEL FUEL DID LEAK FROM LOCOMOTIVES AND WAS RECOVERED AT SITE BY HULCHER ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES.  ROADBED WASHOUT APPEARS TO BE ATTRIBUTED TO DRAINING WATER ADJACENT TO ROADBED FILL - THE INCIDENT DID NOT INVOLVE THE FAILURE OF ANY BRIDGE OR CULVERT STRUCTURE.  CULVERT STRUCTURE LOCATED NEAR DERAILMENT SITE WAS INTACT AFTER DERAILMENT AND SHOWED NO SIGNS OF FAILURE.  LAST TRACK INSPECTION PRIOR TO DERAILMENT WASJANUARY 16, 2002; LAST TRAIN OPERATION PRIOR TO DERAILMENT WAS EASTBOUND T-HAULER ON JANUARY 16TH A
